attributes.action: make cycling more popular, with 20mph speeds, cycle training for all, & cycle networks.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We know we are becoming unhealthier, and take too little exercise.

There is no better way to exercise than cycle or walk.
Slower traffic speeds will make cycling safer, and encourage more children (and adults) to walk and play outside their homes.

There is simply why no reason why cities such as Birmingham cannot have default 20mph speeds, with faster speeds on some roads, and slower on others.

In addition to slow speeds, if we want cycling to become popular, we need all our children to receive cycle training in school so they can cycle safely on our roads. 

We also we need cycle paths by the side of busy roads where speeds are greater than 20mph.

In this way anyone will be able to cycle anywhere without having to cycle on a busy road with speeds above 20mph. Over 25 years, with other measures such as more bus lanes, secure cycle parking, congestion charging, cycling rates can be increased to the 50% level achieved in Denmark and Holland.
